sub_title: Senior Educational Programme Director at PeerVoice |  Resilient problem-solver | Role-model to teenage daughters | Grateful Global Citizen |
summary:
A proactive programme/project director with a B.Sc. (Hons) in Digital Technology, Innovation & Design (Project management), B.Sc (Hons) Physiotherapy, healthcare administration, medical communications, and medical education experience, and natural business acumen. 

Graduate of the Goldman-Sachs Gordon Institute of Business Science 10,000 Women Certificate Program.

Known for being a change facilitator, adept at maximising results with minimum resources and expenditure having worked for multiple non-profit organisations. 
At ease in multi-cultural environments having lived and worked internationally. 
Natural team player capable of facilitating interactions and individual contributions within a team to achieve buy-in and ensure goals are met.

“When others see an uphill battle, I see an opportunity and creative ways to problem solve and take on the challenge.”

school.name: GIBS Business School (Gordon Institute of Business Science)

awards.title: Headmistresses Scholarship
awards.description: A scholarship awarded at the discretion of the headmistress for a girl who demonstrates the values of the schools ethos, and academic excellence.

awards.title: Jaffee Foundation Bursary
awards.description: A bursary issued at the discretion of the foundation for tertiary education. Ali Bacher nominated me for this award based on the potential he saw for me to attend medical school and based on the work I did for him to file and track all press releases, newspaper cuttings, and memorabilia during his time as CEO of the United Cricket Board of South Africa.

awards.title: Old Girls Bursary
awards.description: Bursary awarded to daughter of a Kingsmead Old Girl who met bursary criteria and showed potential to thrive in the school.

profile_positions.description: The European Hematology Association promotes excellence in patient care, research, and education in hematology.

profile_positions.description: Excerpta Medica is a medical communications agency, serving the global pharmaceutical industry with medical strategy consultancy and innovative medical communications programs. Our work is based on combining scientific insights with best practices in communications to develop programs that are engaging and impactful.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager Medical Communications

profile_positions.description:
INTERNATIONAL ENTREPRENEURIAL TEAM PROJECT – Dublin Institute of Technology/Digital Skills Academy (DSA)
Department of Justice - ‘Digitalization of Child Maintenance’
(Final Grade: 93.3%)
•	Submitted and received approval to assess potential to digitalize the child maintenance system in South Africa.
•	Managed team of 3 international students in different locations via online collaboration, using Agile.
•	Completed proof of concept document, plus a thorough customer development process including in-person interviews and 2 online surveys (including front-end applicants, and the back-end Department of Justice). 
•	Liaised with potential partners re technical aspects and established a use case diagram and solution overview. 
•	Developed a fully functional platform prototype based on feedback of user needs.
profile_positions.title: Digital Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
•	Managed case load of patients and clients, and consistently received positive feedback.
•	Recommended process improvements, based on prior managerial experience, to Practice owners.
profile_positions.title: Senior Physiotherapist

profile_positions.description:
•	Founded a social entrepreneurship concept to provide training and employment to disadvantaged South Africans, while meeting a gap in local textile industry for locally produced products.
•	Managed all day to day business functions; accounting, inventory and supply procurement, human resources, payroll, work flow, training, marketing, advertising, client relations, design and product development. 
•	Secured consistent work producing hand-made and small machine-made products with all 7 local children’s clothing brands in South Africa, largest of which is “Naartjie” requesting orders of up to 3000 units/product.
•	Started with 3 part-time employees; grew to 8 full time employees.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
•	Drove strategic planning assignments and developed reports and presentations.
•	Spearheaded office and personal account management, meeting planning, scheduling, and client relations.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager
